data.title: Very friendly service!
data.text: My husband and I aren't big eaters - we're complete failures at getting our money's worth at restaurants like these - but have visited this place twice.  $65 was our total bill (waters only) which is pretty cheap for a Brazilian steakhouse.  Note:  this place is BYOB which is something by husband wishes he had known (he's a boozer).  Meat is fantastic but a little sparse on good veggies.  Wish they just had baked potatoes instead of mashed potatoes (that's more American than Brazilian I guess).  Salad bar was pretty simple but the desserts were GREAT.  Loved the flan and the fried bananas were delicious.  Live music on a Saturday night and easy parking on a quaint Main Street.  It's a fun evening and - if you weigh 250 lbs plus like the big guys sitting at the table next to us - fairly good value for the money.

data.title: Great place for dining
data.text:
Love Villa's Grill.  Meat selection is great.  Staff is very friendly.  I don't like beef cooked rare, so the staff will cook it to med for me. All you have to do is ask. Salad bar isn't large, but there is a nice selection of sides to eat with the meat selections.
Love that it's BYOB. The grilled pineapple at the end of the meal is delicious.

data.title: Villa's on the Cheap
data.text: This place is incredible...and, if you come after church on Sunday, it is phenomenally cheap.  (Maybe 12 bucks?) Great food...great selection, and legit salad bar.  Service is wonderful.  Come check it out!

data.title: Small Venue with a Big Impression
data.text: Great food although this place is not as big as the bigger Brazilian Steak houses this is still worth a visit. The host will make you feel at ease and are very friendly plus for lunch the price was so affordable. I would go back again and again just for lunch. Great meats, awesome sides and two desserts to choose from.

data.title: First and last
data.text: Fist time there food was good, but the waitress was extremely rude she had a big attitude since we were a big group it was obvious everyone was gonna pay there food but she put us all in one check she brought drinks that we didn't order and wanted us to pay for it. When were getting ready to pay she was guessing on our orders because she didn't write anything down so there was no way it could be certain who ordered what. She billed us for 6 drinks we did not order and kept changing numbers we were trying to straighten things out but at the end of the day everyone paid over 200 dollars we were furious but we didn't want to start a problems so we paid and left. I recommend go to another location

data.title: They make a great caipirinha!
data.text: Villa's Grill is BYOB. Bring in a bottle of cachaça and they'll make you Brazil's national cocktail, the caipirinha. They charge 2.99 per glass.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: This was a great place, it was date night and I enjoyed every bit of it.  Staff was great, and nice and quite.

data.title: A tiny, dark place but a delightful evening!
data.text: It's a small place but it's clean, and the food is delicious and the service is solicitous. The owners/staff are proud of the food they prepare and present to you. It's a traditional Brazilian churrascaria with servers walking by offering grilled meats. We tried the pork, lamb, sausage and steak, and all were tender, juicy and delicious. The salad bar pictured offers fresh vegetables, sauces and dressings, along with homemade flan and tres leches cake. Our server brought us fried bananas, and they were delicious as well, and I don't even LIKE banana! Grilled pineapple was offered as well, but we missed it. Next time!

data.title: Authentic Brazilian Churrascaria!
data.text: Villa's is a great Brazilian steakhouse. The food is amazing and the staff is friendly. There are numerous types of grilled meats to try, as well as, a salad bar full of typical Brazilian dishes. The Irving location has a cozy atmosphere, so on busy days it can get a little crowded inside. But you can't beat the price, especially in comparison to some of the big chain churracarias.

data.title: Good Food, Good Service, Classy Environment
data.text:
This is a review of their new location on 12817 Preston (SW corner of Preston and LBJ where Terry Costa is), Dallas, TX.  
Nice white table cloth restaurant with excellent service.  I had the lunch buffet without having the meat on a spit.  Brazilian style arroz e feijao (rice and black beans), hearts of palm (palmetto), stroganoff, flan, rice pudding.  Good eats.  Restaurant wasn't crowded  at all but it was a Monday.  I'd hurry up and go as this new location will start filling up once word gets around.  This is not the kind of place where you would wear shorts.

data.title: Wonderful Churrascaria
data.text: I must admit that this is one of the best churrascaria establishments I've visited and still visit when I can. On this particular week-day, I took a family visiting from overseas to try a Brazilian restaurant and they were in awe of the place. The vegetable salads, food, and of course the meats were great and we ended up spending more than two hours enjoying the ambiance. I personally prefer small churrascarias as opposed to be the big and more expensive ones. I plan to return again and again as I've been doing for many years. This venue is also a BYOB place so bring a bottle of your favorite wine or alcohol for lunch or dinner.

data.title: GREAT CHURRASCARIA!
data.text: Good food for a good price, and a very friendly and efficient wait staff. The fried bananas and succulent little rolls were a delightful surprise!

data.title: Partial to absent large parties
data.text: Last Valentine's day we had a reservation, we were even bringing our young daughter who was very hungry with us. When we got there they did not have our reservation wrote down so we had to wait in a packed restaurant. We told them we called and made a reservation and they said they believed us and remembered my husband calling. Their explanation was that the guy that took the reservation wasn't the normal one who usually took took the reservations. We still had to wait. They had a big section full of tables that were not being used because some huge party was coming in later, on one of the busiest restaurant nights of the year. Well long story short, 1 1/2 hour later that party came in but all the patrons that were there waiting and waiting had to suffer while those tables were going unused. The weird part was it after that torture, we tried to come in during lunch another time because the food is good, but they had the same situation going on... a big section reserved for a party that wasn't even there during lunch. We left without eating. This is a tiny restaurant to begin with! Don't they know that you don't hold big sections on busiest times holidays lunch hours when the party's not there especially with their limited space ...that was ridiculous!!! I wonder how much money they lost those days. Maybe it was for friends of the owners. Horrible professionalism! We haven't been back since!

data.title: Dishonest Owner
data.text: I purchased a $25.00 gift card on-line that had NO EXPIRATION DATE.  It was purchased over a year ago but again stated GIFT CARD DOES NOT EXPIRE!  Tried to use it on 2/10/15 they called Alex, the owner, he said that it was not good.  I called Alex back and told him the gift card said it does not expire and was purchased on restaurant.com.  He said that just means that the amount I paid does not expire.  Alex said that it makes no difference where or when I bought the gift card that it was not good and he would not accept it.  BE CAREFUL PURCHASING ANY KIND OF COUPON FOR THIS RESTAURANT!!  In my opinion Alex is dishonest and will never get my business again!!.

data.title: Brazilian All You Can Eat on a Budget
data.text: Outstanding Food just like the most expensive restaurants, but at a much more reasonable price.  I love the Garlic Steak and, of course, the grilled pineapple.  My wife loves the friend bananas.  It is also BYOB.  If you bring some Brazilian Rum, they have a special drink they'll make for you.  Best of Service and Best Food in a very Casual Environment.

data.title: Great Lunch at Villa's
data.text: My buddy and I went for lunch at Villa's Grill in Irving last week.  We were both impressed with the atmosphere, and especially the food.  The selection of grilled meats for lunch was not as wide as dinner, but all the selections were delicious and delivered hot with sufficient regularity.  I don't go to these types of restaurants for the salad bar or hot buffet items (who does?), but the rice and beans were especially tasty.  All the other reviews I read before my visit said to save room for the glazed pineapple for dessert.  They were right, it was delicious!

data.title: Great churrasqueria at an affordable prince
data.text:
The food was great, and the meat was delicious. We paid $54 US for two, which is what you usually pay for one in a place like Texas d' Brazil. In addition to the great price, you can bring your own bottle of wine (BYOB). The salad bar includes rice, beans, cheese and and a selections of lettuce in addition to other stuff.  My wife got I love with the grill pineapple....

It is a relatively small place in the heart of Irving, TX. Great place to have a fancy dinner with an affordable price. 

The service was great too.

data.title: Awesome bang for the buck!
data.text: No, you can't compare it to one of the big guys, but you're also not paying the big bucks! For around $20, you will eat meat until your pancreas commits suicide, and the Brazilian style flan tops it off! No the salad bar isn't all that, but who goes to a steak house to eat salad?!

data.title: Great little hole-in-the wall restaurant if you love to eat!
data.text: Come hungry!  The staff was friendly.  If you just want the buffet, no meat, it's only $10.  With all you can eat meat it's $25.  It's a great value.  They started right off with a basket of delicious bread and fried bananas.  Then you jump right into the tasty salad bar with good choices.  Once you start into that, they keep bringing you various meats on giant skewers, still sizzling from the grill, and they slice it off right on your plate (various beef, lamb, chicken wrapped in bacon, sausage, chicken thighs, etc). The keep bringing meat until you cry uncle.  Desert was a glazed pineapple, that was also grilled, and sliced onto your plate.  Delicious!

data.title: Awesome Brazilian Steakhouse!
data.text: My cousin and I love to eat at Texas De Brazil but its so pricey we can't eat there often. He discovered this restaurant and I thought I had died and gone to heaven!  Just as good as the chain Brazilian steakhouses but at a fraction of the price!  Salad bar doesn't have quite as much on it but its still very good with lots of variety!  I LOVE this place and will go back every chance I get!!!
